title: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

title: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

title: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

title: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

title: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

title: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

title: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

title: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

title: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

title: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

title: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

title: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

title: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

title: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
author: George Washington

title: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

title: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

title: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you’ll land among the stars.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

title: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

title: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

title: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

title: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

title: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

title: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

title: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

title: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

title: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert H. Schuller

title: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

title: Stay close to anything that makes you glad you are alive.
author: Hafez

title: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn’t know you left open.
author: John Barrymore

title: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

title: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

title: You do not find the happy life. You make it.
author: Camilla Eyring Kimball

title: No matter what you’re going through, there’s a light at the end of the tunnel.
author: Demi Lovato

title: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: Life is short, and it is here to be lived.
author: Kate Winslet

title: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
author: Jim Rohn

title: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line.
author: Lucille Ball

title: Keep your eyes on the stars and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

title: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.
author: Willie Nelson

title: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

title: Your passion is waiting for your courage to catch up.
author: Isabelle Lafleche

title: Magic is believing in yourself. If you can do that, you can make anything happen.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

title: If you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
author: Roald Dahl

title: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

title: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: Light tomorrow with today.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

title: We can do anything we want to if we stick to it long enough.
author: Helen Keller
